duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide therapeutic counseling and support to clients in a clinical setting.
Utilize various therapeutic techniques to address mental health concerns and support positive outcomes for clients.
Conduct clinical assessments to diagnose mental health conditions and develop treatment plans.
Intervene in crisis situations and provide immediate support and guidance to clients in need.
Manage and coordinate the ongoing care and support for clients through effective case management.
Demonstrate empathy and active listening to create a supportive and nurturing therapeutic environment for clients.

education_certification.credential: Master’s degree in Counseling, Marriage and Family Therapy, Social Work or PhD or Psy D in Clinical Psychology
Active and independent license in New Mexico as a psychotherapist (LPCC, LISW, LCSW, LMFT or higher)
Ability to pass a background check
